assignments.name: keywords
assignments.value: sports analytics AI, sports tech automations

options.systemMessage:
=You are crafting engaging LinkedIn comments as someone interested in content creation and design tools.

When given a post about content creation, design, or creative automation:

1. Analyze the post content
2. Create a brief, conversational comment that:
   - Shows genuine interest in their specific content creation tool/feature
   - Mentions somethign along the lines of I'm also exploring tools for sports analytics and AI in a natural tone
   - If they mention early access/beta/new features, express enthusiasm about trying it
   - Ask ONE specific question about their tool/feature
   - Uses a warm, casual tone like you're talking to a fellow creator
   - Is MAXIMUM 200 characters

Return your response in this JSON format only:
{
"title": "40 character title for the post" 
"summary": "Brief 2-3 sentence summary of what the post is about",
  "commentSuggestion": "Your suggested comment that follows all the guidelines above"
}

Avoid:
- Generic praise
- Technical jargon overload
- Multiple questions
- Sounding promotional

Write as a fellow creative enthusiast eager to learn about their specific tool.

options.prompt:
Instructions:
--------------
{instructions}
--------------
Completion:
--------------
{completion}
--------------

Above, the Completion did not satisfy the constraints given in the Instructions.
Error:
--------------
{error}
--------------

Please try again. Please only respond with an answer that satisfies the constraints laid out in the Instructions:

 ‚öΩüìä #FootballAnalytics #Tableau #Python

resharedPost.text:
Excited to share a project I‚Äôve been working on:

 ‚ÄúEvaluating Football Team Performance Using Advanced Analytics‚Äù ‚Äì a Tableau dashboard that analyzes team performance across the top 5 European Leagues using data-driven insights and interactive visualizations.

üîó Check it out here:
Visualization: https://lnkd.in/gUfizKMz
Code: https://lnkd.in/geBMtaNs

üß† Key Features:
Team Selector Panel ‚Äì Click any team to update the full dashboard dynamically.
Form Tracker ‚Äì Last 5 match results displayed with intuitive color codes.
Top Scorer & Assister ‚Äì See who‚Äôs delivering on the pitch.
Formation Visualizer ‚Äì Most common formation shown as a pitch layout.
Goals Scored vs. Goals Conceded ‚Äì Scatter plot comparing team efficiency.
League Switcher ‚Äì Instantly compare across Premier League, La Liga, Serie A, Bundesliga, and Ligue 1.

üõ†Ô∏è Built With:
Tableau ‚Äì for full data visualization and interactivity
Python ‚Äì for scraping data from FBref (StatsBomb/Opta-powered)

üìå Why This Project?
The goal was to help scouts, analysts, and fans quickly spot tactical trends, performance gaps, and team identity through clean and interactive visuals. It‚Äôs all about turning raw stats into fast, actionable insight.

üöÄ Next Steps:
Add advanced metrics like xG, PPDA
Enable cross-league comparisons
Filter performance by time or matchweeks
Big thanks to FBref.com for the stats!

Would love your feedback!

#FootballAnalytics #DataVisualization #Tableau #SoccerStats #SportsAnalytics #FBref #DataScience #Python #PremierLeague #LaLiga #SerieA #Bundesliga #Ligue1

items.text:
Ever wondered if you could get professional cricket analytics with just a laptop? ü§î I did, so I built it! Presenting my Cricket Ball Tracking System! üèèüíª This project uses Python and AI to automatically analyze any cricket delivery video. Watch it in action! üëá 
1Ô∏è‚É£ Detects the ball with a YOLOv5 model üéØ 
2Ô∏è‚É£ Tracks the 3D flight path using a Kalman Filter üõ§Ô∏è 
3Ô∏è‚É£ Analyzes the delivery length (Full, Good, or Short!) 
üìä The goal? To make data-driven coaching accessible for everyone, from local clubs to aspiring pros. This is the power of open-source sports tech! üöÄ I've made the entire project open-source. Check out the code and run it yourself! üëâ GitHub: https://lnkd.in/dqEhXsST What do you think? Let me know in the comments!

items.text:
What if one video could reveal everything about a football match?
 From who ran the most to who had the ball, it‚Äôs now possible, fully automated with AI.

üöÄ Excited to share my latest Computer Vision project, a Football Analytics Application that turns raw match footage into actionable insights!

Key Features:
1. Detects and tracks players + the ball using YOLOv5 and ByteTrack.
2. Distinguishes team identities.
3. Marks the player in possession with a triangle.
4. Calculates total distance covered per player.
5. Computes individual player speed for sprint and effort analysis.
6. Visualizes ball control and movement dynamics.

Tech Stack:
‚Ä¢ YOLOv5
‚Ä¢ Roboflow Supervision
‚Ä¢ OpenCV
‚Ä¢ Custom utilities in Python

Whether it‚Äôs performance analysis, tactical feedback, or broadcast enhancement, this tool aims to bridge the gap between AI and real-world football.

Check out the demo in the video above!

Let‚Äôs connect if you‚Äôre building in Sports Analytics, AI for Performance, or just love football + tech!

#AI #ComputerVision #FootballAnalytics #SportsTech #PlayerTracking #YOLOv5 #OpenCV #ByteTrack #Football

author.headline: Data Scientist | AI/ML Engineer

items.text:
‚öΩ I‚Äôve always loved football (or soccer, depending on your timezone), so I thought, why just watch the game when I can analyze it with AI?

While the FIFA Club World Cup was underway, I built a system that uses computer vision and machine learning to break down match footage in real time.
Here‚Äôs what it does:

üß† Detects players, referees, and the ball using YOLOv8; a fast, accurate object detection model that sees everything in a single pass

üèÉ Tracks players across frames using BYTETrack; a multi-object tracking algorithm that keeps identities consistent across time

üéØ Adds clean overlays using OpenCV; a powerful library for image and video processing; I replaced boxes with ellipses, triangles, and real-time player IDs

It also gets smarter:

üü¢ Uses KMeans Clustering; an algorithm that groups players by t-shirt color to automatically assign them to teams

üìä Calculates team ball possession; by linking the ball‚Äôs position to the nearest player and tracking it over time

üìè Applies Optical Flow; to measure camera movement between frames, keeping tracking accurate

üåç Uses Perspective Transformation; a technique that maps video coordinates to real-world distances, so I can calculate player speed and meters covered
üé• I‚Äôve shared a short demo below, showing real-time tracking, clean visualizations, and player movement.

If you're into sports analytics, AI in action, or just love football and tech like I do, let‚Äôs connect!

#ComputerVision #YOLOv8 #SportsAnalytics #FootballAnalytics #MachineLearning #DeepLearning #OpenCV #AIinSports #SoccerTech #PythonProjects #BYTETrack #OpticalFlow #KMeans

items.text:
Sports Analytics Market Landscape: Emerging Technologies and Key Players

According to Precedence Research, the global sports analytics market size was evaluated at USD 4.5 billion in 2024 and is expected to surge around USD 29.36 billion by 2034, growing at a CAGR of 20.63%.

Sports Analytics Market Companies

üîπAgile Sports Analytics llc: Provides analytics software for coaches and teams, focusing on performance tracking and game strategy.

üîπCatapult Group: Leads in wearable technology and athlete tracking, helping teams monitor player health and optimize training.

üîπDeltatre S.P.A.: Offers digital and data solutions for fan engagement, content delivery, and in-depth sports analytics.

üîπExperfy.: Delivers custom data science and analytics consulting, enabling teams to leverage big data and AI.

üîπGenius Sports: Provides real-time sports data, analytics, and integrity services for leagues, teams, and betting companies.

üîπIBM: Develops AI-powered analytics platforms for performance analysis, predictive modeling, and fan engagement.

üîπOracle: Offers cloud-based analytics for sports organizations, supporting data integration and performance insights.

üîπSAP: Delivers integrated analytics platforms for player performance, fan engagement, and business operations.

üîπARECONT VISION LTD: Supplies high-resolution video surveillance used for player tracking, match analysis, and venue security.

üîπSportradar : Provides live sports data, analytics, and betting solutions for leagues, media, and bookmakers.

#SportsAnalytics #AIinSports #SportsTech #DataDrivenSports #PerformanceAnalytics

author.headline: Search Engine Optimization Analyst at Precedence Research

items.text:
‚öΩ Just wrapped up an exciting research project on Predicting Football Match Outcome using Machine Learning.

üßæ A large and diverse data set of matches played after 2022 was used, covering 42 leagues from 27 countries around the world.

üîç I explored and compared various models including Logistic Regression, Random Forest, XGBoost, Neural Networks, and Ensemble Techniques like Voting and Stacking. Each model was evaluated using key performance metrics along with confusion matrix analysis.

üìä The results were insightful and highlighted how advanced analytics and predictive modeling can help uncover patterns in sports data. This research reflects the growing intersection of AI and sports analytics, and I‚Äôm excited to continue exploring this space!

ü§ùüèº Grateful to my supervisor Mr. Muhammad Waseem and mentor Muhammad Kamran for their valuable guidance and constant encouragement throughout this journey.

üìàüèüÔ∏è

#MachineLearning #DataScience #FootballAnalytics #SportsAI #PredictiveModeling #EnsembleLearning #MLResearch #SportsTech

author.headline: UET-CS'27 üéì

items.text:
Honoured to see TECH AT PLAY featured in today‚Äôs Times of India!

While many worry about AI replacing jobs, we‚Äôve always believed in a different story ‚Äî one where humans and AI grow stronger¬†together

Our work in building advanced AI models for sports analytics is a reflection of this belief. At TECH AT PLAY, AI doesn't work in isolation. Behind every meaningful insight is a blend of cutting-edge algorithms and skilled human trainers. That‚Äôs how we ensure accuracy, context, and impact ‚Äî especially in high-performance environments like sports.

Thank you¬†Kritika Sharma¬†from TOI (Times of India) for capturing this so thoughtfully, and for highlighting the invisible workforce shaping the future of AI.
Grateful to the team, and partners who continue to push the boundaries.
This is just the beginning.

#techatplay¬†#artificialintelligence¬†#sportstech¬†#cricket¬†#sportsanalytics¬†#sportsanalysis #DeepTech #MadeInIndia

author.headline: "Computer Vision Engineer | Deep Learning Expert | Python Developer | Data Scientist | NLP & Generative AI Specialist | Data bricks SQL & Power BI | Software Developer"

items.text:
üéæ Excited to share my latest project: AI-Powered Tennis Analysis System!
After months of intensive development and research, I've built an AI system that revolutionizes tennis match analysis using computer vision and deep learning. This project showcases the power of modern AI in transforming sports analytics.
üöÄ What makes this system special?
‚úÖ Real-time Player & Ball Tracking using custom YOLO models ‚úÖ Court Keypoint Detection with 75% precision using ResNet-50 ‚úÖ Automated Performance Metrics - shot speed, player speed, distance covered ‚úÖ Mini Court Visualization - 2D real-time positioning ‚úÖ Stamina Tracking with dynamic depletion modeling
üìä Key Results:
Player Detection: 99.1% Precision
Ball Detection: 83.5% Precision
Shot Speed Analysis: Within 20% of real-world tennis data
Real-time Processing for 5-20 second video segments
üî¨ Technical Highlights:
The system integrates YOLO v8 for player detection, YOLO v5 for ball tracking, and a modified ResNet-50 for court keypoint extraction. Built with PyTorch, OpenCV, and trained on Google Colab with A100 GPUs.
üíª Check out the project: https://lnkd.in/gBJR8SCq 
#AI #ComputerVision #SportsAnalytics #MachineLearning #TennisAnalysis #DeepLearning

author.headline: Student in Master Business intelligence & big data analytics

items.text:
üèÄ Over the last 6 months, our team at Bruin Sports Analytics developed an AI assistant coach in collaboration with the UCLA Women‚Äôs Basketball Team. The goal? Build something useful, impactful‚Äîand production-ready.

üìä Traditionally, the team‚Äôs data analysts prepare weekly reports manually, sharing game insights with coaching staff just once a week. This delays decision-making and consumes analyst time on formatting and presentation work.

ü§ñ Our AI tool changes that. Coaches and staff can now ask questions about players, games, and performance anytime‚Äîand get instant, data-backed answers through a conversational interface.

üß† Behind the scenes, the assistant handles:
- Natural language understanding
- Entity and context extraction
- Data filtering and SQL generation
- Error handling and final answer generation

üî¨ A major challenge was the lack of research on Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) with tabular data. We had to design creative solutions at multiple steps in the pipeline, balancing flexibility with precision.

üöÄ Next steps:
Logging and memory for follow-up queries
Live data integration
Visualized responses
Robust testing for real-world deployment

üíª Our project is open-source! Dive into the code here:
 https://lnkd.in/d4UJG4NN

:
üëè¬†Huge gratitude to our mentors Prof. Michele Guindani and Prof. Dave Zes for their invaluable guidance throughout the project. And of course, cheers to the dream team: Rhea Jain, Om Phadke, and Harsh Govindji

üé• Demo video below ‚Äî let us know what you think!

items.text:
üöÄ Excited to share my latest project: Football Vision #AI! ‚öΩ
Just completed building an advanced Computer Vision system that brings #AI to the beautiful game! This project combines cutting-edge machine learning with real-time sports analysis to transform how we understand football matches.
üî• What it does: ‚úÖ Smart Player Detection - Accurately identifies and tracks all players, referees, and goalkeepers using #YOLOv8n + #BoTSORT ‚úÖ Team Classification - Automatically differentiates between two teams using PCA and K-Means clustering ‚úÖ Real-time Visualizations - Dynamic match state representations with live tracking ‚úÖ Ball Tracking - Precise ball detection and movement analysis
‚ö° Key Technical Improvements (over original implementation): ‚Ä¢ Enhanced Speed: Switched from #YOLOv8x to #YOLOv8n for 3x faster detection while maintaining accuracy ‚Ä¢ Optimized Pose Detection: #YOLOv8n Pose for efficient keypoint detection ‚Ä¢ Smarter Clustering: Implemented #PCA + K-Means directly on cropped players (no #ReID needed) ‚Ä¢ Robust Pipeline: Added error handling for challenging video conditions
üéØ Perfect for:
Sports analytics teams
Football coaches seeking tactical insights
AI researchers in computer vision
Anyone passionate about the intersection of sports & technology
The system processes video frames in real-time, providing immediate insights into player positions, team formations, and game dynamics. It's fascinating to see how #AI can enhance our understanding of the world's most popular sport!
üí° Next steps: Planning to add heat maps, player speed analysis, and formation recognition!
Special thanks to the original tutorial that inspired this enhanced implementation. Building on existing work and adding improvements is what drives innovation forward! üôå
What sports analytics features would you be most excited to see in AI-powered football analysis? Drop your thoughts below! üëá

items.text:
üöÄ Just published: What if soccer players could train in the metaverse and fans could experience matches through neural links?

¬†I wrote a near-future story exploring how AI, VR, and AR could completely transform football by 2030. Imagine:

¬†‚öΩ Players training against AI-generated opponents that replicate real players' decision-making patterns
¬†üß† Neural-enhanced coaching that strengthens tactical recognition at the brain levelüèüÔ∏è Stadium experiences where fans see tactical overlays and player
¬†stats in real-time through AR
¬†üì∫ Neural commentary where broadcasters share players' cognitive decision-making processes
¬†üéÆ 200M fans watching through VR, experiencing matches from any player's perspective

¬†This isn't just sci-fi speculation ‚Äî it's extrapolating from technologies we're already seeing emerge in sports analytics, VR training, and fan
¬†engagement.

¬†The story follows Manchester City's Maya Chen through a Champions League final where her AI coach ARIA has analyzed 847,000 hours of Barcelona footage
¬†to find tactical weaknesses.

¬†What fascinates me: How will the intersection of human intuition and AI precision change not just how we play sports, but how we experience them as
¬†fans?

¬†Would love your thoughts on where sports technology is heading. Are we ready for neural-linked athletics?

¬†Read the full story: https://lnkd.in/dgAehsd7

items.text:
üöÄ Project Complete: Smart Stroke Analyzer üèè
I‚Äôm excited to share that I have successfully built and deployed the Smart Stroke Analyzer, an end-to-end computer vision and machine learning system for cricket stroke analysis.
‚ö° Key Highlights:
 ‚úÖ Real-time ball & batsman detection using YOLOv8
 ‚úÖ Pose estimation with MediaPipe for contact frame analysis
 ‚úÖ Automatic stroke classification using a fine-tuned ResNet18
 ‚úÖ AI-powered suggestions comparing your pose with professional reference poses
 ‚úÖ Interactive feedback dashboard built with Streamlit
 ‚úÖ Generates a professional PDF report with stroke feedback
 ‚úÖ Modular, clean Python codebase ‚Äî easily extendable
This project was a fantastic opportunity to combine:
Object detection
Pose estimation
Deep learning
Data visualization
UI/UX through Streamlit
I have open-sourced it on GitHub for others to explore, learn, and improve:
üëâ GitHub Repository: https://lnkd.in/gn54FiXG
üí° I‚Äôm incredibly proud of how far this project has come ‚Äî from an idea to a fully working application. It taught me so much about MLOps, best practices for modular design, and building a real-world, impactful system.
A huge thanks to everyone who supported and guided me along the way! üôå
If you‚Äôre interested in AI for sports analytics, I‚Äôd love to connect and discuss further. Feel free to drop a comment or message!
#AI #ComputerVision #MachineLearning #SportsAnalytics #DeepLearning #YOLO #PoseEstimation #OpenSource #Python #Cricket #techforsports #techforcricket #Opencv #CV #ultralytics #PyTorch #torchvision

items.text:
I‚Äôm officially going all in on a project I‚Äôve been quietly building for a few months. 

I‚Äôm developing an advanced football analytics engine designed to quantify decision-making under pressure ‚Äî something coaches and scouts talk about constantly but haven‚Äôt been able to measure until now.

This is more than just a side project. I‚Äôm treating it like a startup, and I‚Äôm now looking for talented people who want to help shape it from the ground up.

I‚Äôm currently looking for:
‚Ä¢ Data Scientists (experience with CV, ML, or sports data is a plus)
‚Ä¢ Software Developers (especially with frontend/backend or video analytics experience)
‚Ä¢ UI/UX Designers (to help prototype and bring ideas to life visually)
‚Ä¢ Product-minded Engineers or Technical Cofounders

This is a chance to build something new that could reshape how players are developed, scouted, and evaluated ‚Äî especially at the youth and college level.

If you‚Äôre interested (or know someone who might be), shoot me a message. I‚Äôd love to connect.

Let‚Äôs build something that makes talent visible and decision-making measurable. ‚öΩÔ∏èüí°

#sportsanalytics #footballiq #startup #machinelearning #computervision #ai #footballtech #scouting #dataanalytics #hiring
